messages.msgSnippet: I read the sentence the same way, too, at first.  But I like to iron.  It s very meditative.  I like to wash dishes, too.  My mind just wanders to the most
messages.messageBody:
I read the sentence the same way, too, at first. But I like to iron. It's
very meditative. I like to wash dishes, too. My mind just wanders to the
most interesting places.

I don't like vacuuming. So noisy. But sweeping is just fine.
Another repetitive, meditative, Zen-like activity.

Carron

messages.msgSnippet: Me too, I was reading this at 1 a.m., and my first thought was I hope unschooling has NOTHING to do with ironing, since I hate ironing.  Too funny :) Jodi
messages.messageBody:
Me too, I was reading this at 1 a.m., and my first thought was I hope unschooling has NOTHING to do with ironing, since I hate ironing. Too funny :)

Jodi

kbcdlovejo@... wrote:
I got this off-list, but I thought it was so funny. I needed to share!
I thought y'all would enjoy it too!

~Kelly

-----Original Message-----

I would really make sure your iron is in good shape. That's a HUGE
problem with me: low iron.
__________________________-

I'm only replying to you because I don't want to clog up the list, but
OMG I was skimming through my email waiting for waffles to cook and
while skimming your post I thought, "No way am I getting my iron
out...I
hate ironing!" then I got the context, but it was a funny moment.
